hits.name: Million.js
hits.long_description:
Million.js is an open source tool that makes React.js 70% faster.

We want to make Million a web embed that allows developers to select and ask why parts of a page are slow and automatically generate a GitHub pull request with a fix using AI.

Today, most developers spend weeks trying to comprehend flame graphs and execution traces, debug with frustration, and give up. We realized that web developers don’t want to put the grimy work to make their app performant. Instead, we fix performance issues automatically, with no migration.

Our end goal is to make all applications automatically fast, starting from frontend to backend, and eventually mobile apps & infrastructure.
hits.one_liner: Copilot for optimizing web performance

hits.name: SyncUp.ai
hits.long_description:
SyncUp automates status updates for leadership and generates a top-down AI dashboard to show them which teams need their time the most.

The problem: At companies over 50, status update meetings are EXPENSIVE. But today, they’re a top way for leadership to hold teams accountable and unblock them. Companies try to solve this with OKR reviews, slack updates, or cascading review meetings, but these processes are hard to maintain and often break down.

The solution: SyncUp automatically requests a templatized weekly scorecard from each team, and generates a report for leaders showing which teams need help and which are progressing smoothly. Teams fill out their weekly scorecard with progress, blockers, and goal status. Leadership gets an AI dashboard, reporting which teams need attention and which are running smoothly toward goals
hits.one_liner: SyncUp automates status updates for leadership

hits.name: kater.ai
hits.long_description:
Kater is a platform which allows anyone to answer their data questions using plain English. 

With a simple chat-like interface and an innovative data discovery catalog, Kater lets your company extract maximum value from your data by prompting individuals to proactively explore and analyze data relevant to their roles.

Yvonne was a data engineer who built the entire data stack at her previous company. Robin was the fastest engineer at his former company. 

After experiencing the data accessibility problem first-hand, they're reimagining analytics where data is discoverable, trustworthy, and understandable. 

Data is the new oil. Kater is forging a future where decision-makers can uncover valuable insights that may have been previously limited by the scope of specialized data teams.

This is the future of data.

hits.name: Powder
hits.long_description:
Powder is building a generative-AI co-analyst to help wealth advisors win new clients by automating the sales process.  Wealth Advisors have an arduous sales process that has little transparency and leaves prospective clients unclear of the value they provide.  Advisors relying on their current manual operations are facing a tremendous challenge to scale.

Powder is for wealth advisors who are frustrated with burning costly analyst time making sense of prospects’ portfolio data, dealing with very long sales timelines to win over prospects, struggling to create beautiful presentations that highlight their value to prospects and looking to leverage the latest technology to future proof their firm.

Powder helps wealth advisors -

-By leveraging Powder’s generative-AI document and conversation extractor to rapidly leverage the prospect’s portfolio.

-By fine tuning analytics that automatically demonstrate better investment returns, reduced portfolio risk, reduced tax consequence and lowered investment fees.

-Creating beautiful presentations that succinctly outline the benefits to the prospective clients.

SooYung and Kanishk encountered this problem repeatedly while they were building their prior company RCI Navigator (acquired by Addepar).  Growth is just as important as retention, but there isn't a purpose built platform for growth.  Additionally, as we started to build, we realized that generative AI can solve many of the manual tasks that have been haunting the advisors for decades.  Advisors are itching to adopt AI to future proof themselves.

We are currently signing on firms on yearly contracts.  The list is growing quickly to 10+ with severals more firms on the cusp of adopting Powder.

hits.name: Arcane
hits.long_description:
At Arcane, we're building a AI-powered platform for storytelling and role-playing games. You create a rich world world of characters, locations, storylines and items, and then play games in that world. 

Our first product is Summon Worlds, available at https://www.summonworlds.com. In Summon Worlds, you can create Summons, with backstories, images, stats and more. People have summoned millions of creations so far, and used them in multiplayer campaigns and AI-powered chats. 

We use generative AI all over Summon Worlds: to create summons, help run games, invent stories, and for character chat. We're building an AI that can quickly invent a rich world, and then create storylines, have NPCs with rich dialogue and backstories, and create games that are immersive and fun to play. 

Rohan and Lucas were both software engineers at Meta. While at Meta, we worked together on AR Glasses and Gen AI. We love building consumer products, and are excited to help bring the power of modern AI to everyone.

hits.name: Lumona
hits.long_description:
At Lumona, we're transforming the way people search online.

Searching should be effortless for any question, no matter if you're looking for a website, have a question about what a certain tax form is, or researching the latest methods for fine-tuning LLMs. However, each search option comes with tradeoffs. Some are great at getting you to where you want to go, others are great for answering your questions, and a few are good for research. If you're looking for something on a social media platform, searching is even more difficult, with the search features of these platforms often failing to guide users effectively, leading them to creatively use traditional search engines by adding terms like 'reddit' to their queries to uncover more relevant results. This “hacky” solution only searches Reddit when a more accurate answer or crucial context may lie somewhere else that currently requires additional searches to find. Moreover, the prevalence of misinformation adds another layer of complexity, as unverified data and prioritized SEO-driven results can mislead users.

LLMs have enabled the automatic ingestion and understanding of huge amounts of information. Instead of summarizing links from existing search techniques, our approach is to use LLMs to build our index. This approach enables us to understand each website's meaning, place it into context with similar pages, and fully understand what the user's search query means, allowing us to not only get you where you want to go but answer any question and help you research any topic along the way.

We're a group of 3 MIT students with internships at companies like Google, Stripe, and Reddit who started work on Lumona in September 2023 after winning HackMIT. We have experience planning, building, and shipping new features and projects from start to finish in diverse company environments. Growing up in the age of social media, we are poised to tackle the ever-widening gap between current search solutions and our needs.
hits.one_liner: Semantic search for the internet.

hits.name: Fluently
hits.long_description:
Fluently is an app that helps non-native speakers improve their communication skills with feedback after each day-to-day call.

There are 84 million non-native employees who work in English-speaking environments, and companies spend $10 billion annually solely on their English corporate training to improve communication efficiency across the company and help them grow and feel more confident.

Fluently offers a more efficient and convenient way to boost speaking skills by providing feedback on pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary after each call and fine-tuning the learning trajectory over time. That became possible by recent advancements in ML and the power of M1 chips for local processing.

We are non-native founders who solves their pain, and have deep expertise in running ML on edge devices.

Imagine having a personal coach nearby, always listening to you and providing helpful guidance afterwards. That’s Fluently.
hits.one_liner: AI-powered speaking coach for calls

hits.name: Velorum Therapeutics
hits.long_description:
Velorum Therapeutics is developing a new class of cancer drugs that starve tumors by hijacking cancer metabolism. We have shown our drugs work in mice and plan to begin human clinical trials next year, starting with the #1 cancer killer – lung cancer. 

Essentially, we’ve discovered that cancers are addicted to a molecule called ‘heme’. Heme, which is well-known as the central component of ‘hemoglobin’, is used by the mitochondria to make energy. Cancers ‘steal’ free-floating heme from the blood to fuel their rapid growth. Our patented drugs starve cancer by removing this heme that cancer cells need, but normal cells don’t. We’ve shown in animals that our drugs are highly effective for multiple cancers, without affecting healthy cells, even at the highest doses. Also, by starving tumors we make them weaker and more susceptible to existing cancer treatments, like radiation, chemo, and immunotherapies. 
 
The body has a natural system to clean up this free-floating heme, but it gets overwhelmed in cancer. Our drugs essentially amplify the body’s natural heme removal system. We let nature do most of the work – our drugs are built from proteins that have evolved over millennia to be perfect at capturing heme. Importantly, heme is the exact same molecule across all mammals, meaning the results we see in animals have a higher chance of translating to humans.
 
We’re starting with lung cancer, with a lead drug advancing to first-in-human trials next year. Because multiple types of cancers have this same vulnerability, our lead drug could potentially be used for lots of cancer types and become a standard-of-care treatment. 

Parsa and Pouya are twin-brothers and scientists who spent their entire adult lives studying how cancers make energy. They worked together on this breakthrough science for the past 5 years, helping develop this promising new class of cancer drugs. They dropped out of medical school to found Velorum, surrounding themselves with a team of world-class drug developers, scientists, and clinicians to advance this breakthrough to patients.
hits.one_liner: Powerful cancer drugs that starve tumors

hits.name: Draftaid
hits.long_description:
DraftAid is the world's first generative AI for CAD manufacturing drawings, akin to GitHub Copilot but for CAD. It drastically shortens drawing creation time, turning hours into seconds.

Every product that is manufactured - from construction to aerospace, automotive, durable goods, and electronics—relies on drawings. Currently, engineers and designers painstakingly make these essential drawings manually. Draftaid streamlines this process saving teams millions in time and quality. 

The idea was born out of Abdullah's experience as a mechanical design team member, where he created thousands of drawings and longed for a more efficient process. Partnering with Tahsin, a neighbour with a PhD in AI, and Mohammed, a seasoned engineering VP with experience in construction software, they turned the dream into reality.

Since their launch in August, DraftAid has engaged customers through targeted outreach and word-of-mouth, securing paid pilots with subsequent contracts valued at $150,000.

Be a part of ushering in the new era of CAD designs!
hits.one_liner: AI-copilot for manufacturing drawings

hits.name: Ellipsis
hits.long_description:
Ellipsis is a AI developer tool that converts technical instructions into working, tested code.

Working with Ellipsis is like working with a virtual colleague; first, a developer tags Ellipsis on GitHub or sends it a Slack message. Then Ellipsis explores the codebase, makes the required changes, and creates a pull request with the implementation.

Ellipsis runs in the cloud so developers can make progress on other tasks while Ellipsis writes or reviews code on their behalf. The product integrates with GitHub, Slack, and Linear, allowing for code generations that consider the product roadmap.

The team launched automatic code review in late December. Since then, the team has secured several paying customers and been deployed across 17 teams.

hits.name: OpenCopilot
hits.long_description:
Siri, but for your own product. We are building a way to let your SaaS product's users chat with your product functionality and execute things just by text (natural language).

⭐ It will give your product's users a new text/voice-based interface that is much easier to interact with, the copilot will have access to your product's APIs, so it can call them and retrieve/add data to and from them.

⭐ ➡️ For example, If Jira used OpenCopilot, Jira users could ask things like "Please create a new board, and then add new tickets about our payments migration project then assign X on it". So no more clicks on the UI, they can describe whatever they want to do via text. 

⭐ ➡️ Most of your flows will be automatically handled (you do not need to configure it), or you can define them manually via our flows editor.

We are 100% open source with more than 2500 stars on GitHub!
hits.one_liner: Siri, but for your own product.

hits.name: Markprompt
hits.long_description:
Close customer support tickets faster with AI.

We’re building AI infrastructure to power customer support at scale. With Markprompt, companies can automate customer support, scale without increasing headcount, and deliver exceptional user experiences.
 
Scaling customer support with headcount is expensive, with human resources accounting for 90%+ of customer support expenses. On top of that, customer support agents often burn out leading to turnover and reduced quality. As companies grow, so does their expert knowledge, which is hard to access at scale and makes keeping employees up-to-date nearly impossible.

Markprompt addresses the root of the information access problem by indexing all available knowledge within a company, setting the foundation for a robust system of record to feed the AI. Built from the ground up with an API-first approach, Markprompt provides SDKs (such as React hooks and components) and no-code tools to enable integrations at all touchpoints in the customer journey.
hits.one_liner: AI for customer support

hits.name: Celest
hits.long_description:
Celest is a backend-as-a-service for Flutter and Dart developers. It empowers Flutter developers with the tools and capabilities they need to become full-stack developers. We are introducing "Cloud Widgets", a set of primitives which enable you to declaratively define every piece of your backend and infrastructure in Dart.

As the role of the front-end developer evolves towards full-stack proficiency, we recognize that existing tools have fallen short for those specializing in Flutter. Using the programming language and patterns Flutter developers already know from building their frontend, Celest enables developers to build and connect their apps to their backend with no additional tooling.

We enable Flutter developers to concentrate on building features and delivering value to their customers rather than learning additional domains and fragmenting themselves across disparate toolchains.
hits.one_liner: The Flutter cloud platform

hits.name: Yoneda Labs
hits.long_description:
Yoneda Labs provides software to help chemists optimise reactions. When chemists make a drug or a material, we help them figure out the best reaction parameters such as temperature, concentration and catalyst.

When Jan was working at chemical labs, he experienced the struggle of spending weeks guessing reaction conditions. We then started experimenting with ML to speed up the process.

Now, as a team of three friends from the University of Cambridge, we’ve spent the last month combining our domain expertise in Computer Science, Machine Learning and Chemistry to develop state of the art models for reaction optimisation.

Although ML is becoming well established in other fields, current chemical models generalise poorly and require lots of programming experience. We make our models easily accessible to chemists in the lab.

Finding the right conditions quickly allows pharmaceutical companies to test more drugs, and finding better optima makes manufacturing process cheaper and more environmentally friendly.
hits.one_liner: Optimising Chemical Reactions

hits.name: Artisan AI
hits.long_description:
Artisans are advanced human-like digital workers trained to do specific roles, who integrate alongside human teams. They have unique faces, names, memories & skills, and they continuously improve once they are employed, molding to each company's needs. Alongside our core business, we're leading cutting-edge research into how to create the most functional and human-like digital workers with Artisan Labs. 

Our first Artisan, Ava, automates the entire outbound sales process and can be set up with a 10-minute conversation. Ava creates TCPs, prospects with her database of over 270,000,000 contacts, crafts & sends highly bespoke email sequences, and books meetings into your calendar. And, you can manage all features & settings by talking to Ava via Slack. 

We're not creating another SaaS product for teams to use, we're creating new team members. 

This is the next Industrial Revolution.

hits.name: BondCenter
hits.long_description:
Surety bonds are financial guarantees that businesses must purchase to comply with government regulations. For example, all contractors must have a surety bond to bid and work on federal construction projects. It is a $8b opportunity in the US. 

BondCenter is building the surety bond platform for the 21st century. Businesses can apply for bonds and receive affordable quotes online in minutes. We offer the fastest and simplest online experience for getting surety bonds.

Bonds are also purchased through insurance brokers, who receive bond requests but don’t have the expertise to handle them. BondCenter partners with insurance brokers to provide them with a custom-branded surety bond purchase portal that they can share with customers. We then handle everything from bond issuance to renewal, making bonds profitable for insurance agents.
hits.one_liner: The Modern Surety Bond Platform

hits.name: Argon AI, Inc.
hits.long_description:
Argon AI is a platform where biopharma and life sciences professionals can execute complex and data driven workflows using natural language. We help professionals get thorough answers to questions about clinical trials, existing treatments, healthcare landscape, and the competitive market in minutes rather than months. 

Prior to starting Argon, Samy was responsible for Flatiron Health’s (Roche) first data analytics project which eventually led to the start of the Flatiron Services business unit. There, he saw first-hand the heavily manual process that biopharma companies struggle through to get the insights they need to drive forward their drug development programs. He also helped close over $6M+ in ARR and is an expert in enterprise pharma sales.

Cyrus and Frances are building the software to tackle the insights generation problem using recent breakthroughs in AI. Frances previously studied geophysics at Stanford and has built scalable and secure ML / AI solutions at multiple high-growth startups including Cloudflare and OneSignal. Cyrus previously led engineering teams and built 0 to 1 across pre-seed and unicorn startups, and managed mission-critical trade generation systems at Bridgewater.

Breakthroughs in AI present an opportunity to reinvent biopharma and life science workflows to reduce the time and cost of bringing treatments to patients where delays in bringing a drug to market can cost a pharma company $3M / day.

We started in August and launched our Beta in December and already have $8,633.33 MRR and are growing 90% month over month.
hits.one_liner: Automating clinical & commercial data analysis for life sciences

hits.name: Adagy Robotics
hits.long_description:
Adagy is a remote intervention service that rescues robots when they fail. For example, when a tractor robot gets lost in a field, instead of calling the farmer for help, it can now call Adagy, whose operators will take control of the robot and remotely drive it back to safety. 

We’re starting with trained human operators assisted by generative AI, and as we collect more data, our model will learn to handle more of the edge cases. 

We want to see a world with more robots, so we’re addressing the biggest problem in robot deployment: reliability.

hits.name: Nuanced, Inc.
hits.long_description:
Nuanced detects AI-generated images. We help companies like dating apps, news sites, and ad platforms to distinguish between AI-generated and human-authored content. 

With AI-generated content on the rise, many contexts require differentiating it from human-authored materials to ensure authenticity and trust in the digital world. Making this distinction is especially crucial when there are possible implications for misinformation, spam, abuse, or cybercrime. Existing technologies are ill-equipped to do so, costing an annual $78 billion spent on handling deepfakes. 

Our API allows integrators to use AI to get ahead of AI easily, without having to spin up their own infrastructure. We train custom models in a zero PII environment, removing the risk of compromising user privacy. 

Ayman and Dylan met as undergraduate engineering students at the University of Waterloo. Each cofounder has over a decade of engineering and research experience.

Ayman most recently spent 7 years at GitHub, contributing to several areas of the product, including building and scaling abuse mitigation infrastructure for over 100 million users. While at GitHub, she saw first-hand how AI-driven threats were evolving, including witnessing established methods fail to detect user profiles that were generated by ChatGPT. Ayman’s experience at GitHub and her dissertation research in machine learning-based cloud platform security at the University of Oxford drove her to found Nuanced.

Dylan has over a decade of machine learning experience spanning industry and academia, culminating in a notable 6-year tenure as an Applied AI Scientist at Amazon.

They both quickly agreed that online content creation and consumption were rapidly changing and wanted to build something to help online platforms address evolving authenticity concerns. This is why Nuanced provides a user-friendly API that helps restore the authenticity and trust of services.
hits.one_liner: We detect AI-generated content to distinguish human-authored materials

hits.name: Precip
hits.long_description:
Precip monitors rainfall at remote locations without needing to install weather stations. We do it by using high-resolution models that answer how much it rained in an easy to use dashboard and API.

Our platform helps customers: avoid getting stuck in mud, automatically pause irrigation after a rain, find standing water and treat it before a new batch of mosquitos are incubated, automatically assess flood damage for insurance claims, and countless other weather impacted operational decisions that can’t be made with forecast data alone.
hits.one_liner: Precision rainfall tracking without gauges

hits.name: Sonia
hits.long_description:
Sonia is an AI mental health therapist that conducts entire voice and text-based therapy sessions via a phone app.

20% of the population suffer with their mental health each year. Today, you need to wait several months to get a therapy appointment and pay more than $100 per session. With Sonia, you receive support directly from your bed when your crisis kicks in at 2am.

The three of us studied computer science together at ETH Zurich and did our graduate studies and research at MIT, publishing several research papers on LLMs.

We are making mental health care accessible to anyone, anywhere and anytime - for a fraction of today’s cost. Our iOS app is with several users talking to Sonia almost daily.

hits.long_description:

It is ChatGPT with real-time updated knowledge of your codebase, as well as any public/open-source library. 

You can start using Onboard with just two clicks - just sign-in with GitHub and paste-in the name of any GitHub repo.

Mohamed and Adam are technical co-founders who met while studying Computer Science at Cornell University. Before starting RadMate AI to solve the problems his dad faced as a radiologist, Adam worked at Palantir on the initial launch of Palantir’s Al Platform. hits.name: Driver AI
hits.long_description:
Driver AI is a tool that explains millions of lines of code in minutes instead of months. When you need to do technical discovery, you can use Driver AI’s interactive documentation to understand complex codebases at a fraction of the time and cost.

Even better, Driver AI automatically stays in sync as the business evolves, so the technical discovery process only gets faster over time. 

Co-founders Daniel and Adam are engineers who have been building companies and software at the intersection of signal processing and machine learning for over a decade. Our third co-founder, Jimmy, has led finance and operations for some of the most successful technology companies in the world, from large global leaders to high-growth start-ups.

After selling his last company, Adam led various software efforts in innovation at Nike. But he kept encountering the same problem: Nothing new could be built without a long and very expensive tech discovery process. It was maddening. He soon discovered this problem was everywhere—from enterprise IT to embedded software development teams—and, with Jimmy and Daniel, built Driver AI to fix it. 

The eagerness of early customers to engage with us across a wide range of industries has been unlike any idea we have worked on before. One SVP at a leading Global Semiconductor Company recently called Driver AI “a paradigm shift for managing our complex software delivery pipeline.”

hits.name: Lantern
hits.long_description:
Lantern is the easiest way to build AI applications using Postgres.

We started Lantern because we believe AI is going to impact every single enterprise in every single industry. We want to allow every company to tap into their unstructured data to build better applications.

With Lantern Cloud, developers have access to everything they need to build an AI application: embedding generation, vector search, efficient indexing, on top of the database they already know, Postgres.

Check out our code on Github: https://github.com/lanterndata/lantern

hits.name: Danswer
hits.long_description:
Danswer is the AI assistant that connects to all your company tools and docs and makes finding any piece of information a breeze. Think ChatGPT, but with access to all your companies documents (only the ones you have access to, of course :P). Or, if you know Glean, you can think about it like an open-source Glean. 

Concerned about your data? Don't worry we're fully open source (MIT license) and built to be self-hosted. You can setup Danswer in your VPC in less than 30 minutes - no packets ever have to leave your cloud.

Check us out on Github: https://github.com/danswer-ai/danswer!
